p: A total of five medicinal uses of Chiliadenus glutinosus have been compiled, applied in the form of poultices, washes, ointments, or plasters. These uses have been reported in eight Autonomous Communities and have been aimed at treating conditions of the integumentary system. The fresh leaves of the plant have been applied in a poultice as a remedy for skin pimples in Navarre. Other reported uses are the use of the species as an infusion or decoction to wash and disinfect wounds and bruises in Region of Murcia and southeast of Castilla-La Mancha; the preparation of a healing ointment with the plant to apply also on wounds and bumps on the skin, and in the form of a decoction to relieve the discomfort caused by the insect bites such as mosquitoes in Albacete. In other locations in southeast and east of Castilla-La Mancha, plasters are prepared to treat skin burns or the resulting decoction is applied to them; also, in north of Andalusia, the species is used in the form of decoction or infusion to reduce inflammation of skin wounds ( Table 7).
